title: What is the significance of the Princedom of Alercy in Hermeticism and Fedeli d'Amore?
first_phrase: This text explores the connection between Hermeticism and the Fedeli d'Amore. It cites the Princes de Alercy, members of a Masonic order in France or Germany in the 18th century, whose task is to guard traditional wisdom. Their temple, the Third Heaven, is associated with Venus. The author notes that in Orphism and Pythagoreanism, the Third Heaven was the final one. The text also mentions the Palladium of the Order, a statue of Truth covered in a tricolored veil, and the symbolic colors of green, white, and red. The final 200 tokens delve deeper into the symbolic significance of the Princes de Alercy and their rituals.

I Principi di Mercede « pervengono mediante la loro triplice virtù a sollevare il velo della verità »; e si chia mano perciò berti émetb, i figli della Verità. Tra i sim boli caratteristici del grado figura il Palladio dell'Or dine, ossia « la statua della Verità, ignuda e coperta di un velo tricolore ». Questi tre colori che ricompaiono nella decorazione (lel Tempio ed in altri simboli del grado sono il verde, il bianco ed il rosso, i tre colori ermetici, i tre colori di cui Dante adorna la sua Beatrice (Purg. last_phrase: In conclusion, the Principi di Mercede is a secret society that symbolizes the pursuit of truth through initiation and enlightenment. Their symbolism is deeply rooted in numerology, with the number three being significant to their beliefs. The Palladio dell'Or dine, a statue of truth draped in a tricolored veil, and the Delta Luminoso are two of the main symbols of this secretive group. With nine lights on the throne, nine columns in the temple, and a total of 81 lights, these numbers represent the sacredness of the journey towards truth in the Principi di Mercede's beliefs.
